Commentary: Virat Kohli at the moment can run through the stone wall for his team. He is carrying the weight of a nation on his shoulder formidably well. But battles aren't won by a single individual, he needs the rest of the troops to show fight and character too. It?s high time, he and his think-tank sitting in the dressing room get their team combinations right after looking at the 22 yards. That's it from all of us for the coverage of this debut Test match at this venue. We can trust the traditional Boxing Day Test at the MCG to be as thrilling as the first two matches have been and you can trust us to bring you the best coverage. This is Varun Dixit signing off on behalf of Ramakrishnan, KAD, Sriram, Abhinand and Venky.

Lyon to Vijay, no run, that linears after landing.. Vijay initially thought of playing it on the on-side but then squares up and defends it into the off-side
Lyon to Vijay, no run, goes back and pats the ball out into the off-side
Lyon to Vijay, no run, nice bit of turn into the batsman and has been blocked out into the off-side
Lyon to Rahane, 1 run, charges out and clips the ball away off the inner half of the bat for a single to deep square leg
Lyon to Rahane, no run, turns in and has been blocked off the front foot

Lyon to Kohli, out Caught by Khawaja!! That is the clincher. Kohli is gone. Kohli played for the turn, it did not spin in much and went off the outer edge into the safe hands of the slip fielder. India in a soup now. Kohli pressed forward but the lack of turn on that ball did him in. Lyon continues to scalp Kohli. Aussies have their tail up now. Kohli c Khawaja b Lyon 17(40) [4s-2]
Starc to Kohli, 1 run, looks to push forward with a positive stride and gets an inside edge into the on-side for a single
Starc to Kohli, no run, push drive back to the bowler. Starc mocks a throw at the batter
Starc to Kohli, no run, shorter delivery outside off and has been left alone
Starc to Kohli, no run, fuller and well away from the sticks, left untouched
Starc to Kohli, no run, angling across the skipper who has his bat held high to let that go
Starc to Kohli, no run, shorter delivery outside off and has been ignored
Lyon to Vijay, no run, well forward, smothers the turn and defends it
Lyon to Vijay, no run, looks to rock back and punch it, inner-halves the ball away into the off-side
Lyon to Vijay, no run, goes for the sweep and finds the man at 45 degrees
Lyon to Vijay, no run, and now it dips and explodes a little off the rough to take a part of the glove and die down
Lyon to Vijay, no run, plants his front foot well outside the line of the sticks and misses the sweep. Huge appeal but it dies down quickly
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, goes back and tucks the ball away to deep mid for a single. First run off Lyon
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, stays firmly behind the line of the ball and blocks it off the back foot
Pat Cummins to Vijay, 2 runs, cracking drive on the up! Could have been the shot of the day had the man at point not dived and stopped it. They still get a couple. Into the 20s goes Vijay
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, length delivery outside off and has been stabbed out into the off-side with a forward stride
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, bangs the ball in does Pat Cummins and Vijay sits under it to let it go
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, length delivery zipping away and has been ignored outside off
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, solidly behind the line of the ball and blocked into the off-side
Lyon to Kohli, no run, stays behind the line of the ball and nurdles it to the man at FSL
Lyon to Kohli, no run, stays behind the line of the ball and knocks it behind square. Yet to concede a run
Lyon to Kohli, no run, flatter ball and has been tucked away to short mid by hitting it on top of the bounce
Lyon to Kohli, no run, again tucked away to FSL
Lyon to Kohli, no run, tucks the ball off the pads and it finds short mid
Lyon to Kohli, no run, bouncing from a length and spinning away down leg, Kohli goes back to work it to the leg-side, gets a soft leading edge down the pitch as he closes the bat face early
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, Cummins shortens his length just outside off, Vijay jumps back and punches it to cover

Pat Cummins to Vijay, 2 runs, Vijay looking more and more confident. Pitched up just outside off, Vijay bends his back knee, flails his hands and spanks the drive through the gap at cover. Picks up a couple of runs
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, length delivery, exemplary line at the stumps. Vijay was slightly backing away and defends it to cover
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, cross-seam back of a length delivery outside off, Vijay sees it through to the keeper
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, 141.6kph, fuller and just outside off. Kohli leans into a drive through cover. There's protection in the deep and Lyon keeps the pair down to a single
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, back of a length, keeping it tight there Cummins. Kohli defends it off the back foot
Lyon to Vijay, no run, more revs and loop, Vijay blocks it
Lyon to Vijay, no run, touch quicker on the stumps, Vijay crouches low and works it to mid-wicket
Lyon to Vijay, no run, darted quick just outside off, Vijay kneels down and sweeps it along the ground to backward square leg
Lyon to Vijay, no run, gets forward and smothers the spin
Lyon to Vijay, no run, Vijay doesn't want Lyon to hit the rough. Preempts a sweep and takes it from outside off, sends it to short fine leg - who makes a good stop
Lyon to Vijay, no run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, Vijay camps back and turns it to short leg
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, back of a length and moving away just outside off, Kohli lifts his bat and lets it go

Pat Cummins to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli puts his dexterous wrists into play. Too full and straight from Cummins, trying to bluff Kohli. The Indian captain gets across and whiplashes it firmly through mid-wicket
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, woah! Steamy. This bounce sprang after hitting a crack. Kohli wanted to pull but it soars over his head. Fantastic grab by Paine
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, pacy length delivery, cutting Kohli for space and room. Stabbed down the pitch
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, fuller and at the stump, Kohli gets his body weight forward and checks his drive with a full bat face. Starc from mid-on moves swiftly across and intercepts it
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, short outside off, Kohli points his bat towards gully and dabs it with soft hands
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, length delivery, straightening just outside off. Vijay trusts his instincts and lets it pass. Good leave
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, Hazlewood corrects his length and bangs it short, keeps coming back at Vijay - who drops his gloves and sways his head out of the line

Hazlewood to Vijay, FOUR, Vijay takes a cue from Kohli. It wasn't overpitched by any means. Just that Vijay leant into the drive with his hands flowing towards the ball and creamed it off the meat through extra cover. Looked like he just checked his shot, such flawless timing
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, fuller and seems like it was straightening, Vijay with feet rooted to his crease blocks it down the pitch
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, back of a length and swerving in just outside off, Vijay gauges it well and leaves

Hazlewood to Kohli, 3 runs, Kohli unveils his trademark cover drive. Overpitched slightly just outside off, Kohli cashes in with a pristine drive through extra cover. Head gives a long chase and hauls it back, saving a solitary run for his team

Pat Cummins to Kohli, byes, 1 run, was there an edge? No, given as byes. This fuller delivery, scoots low and befuddles Kohli as he flirts at it. Awkward bounce for Paine, makes a half-stop and they will steal a bye
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, shorter at the body, a hopping Kohli defends it to mid-on
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, climbing from a length, Kohli waits back and turns the ignition off on this delivery
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, shortish outside off, Kohli jumps back and pushes it to cover
Pat Cummins to Vijay, 1 run, angled on leg, Vijay works it to mid-wicket and calls his skipper through for a quick single
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, 137kph, fuller length delivery around fourth stump line. Vijay ignores and Paine collects it in front of his face
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, back of a length and just outside off, Kohli hops back and defends it to point
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, in-ducker on a fuller length, kicks up and Kohli couldn't counter the bounce. Misses the inside edge and rams him on the back thigh
Hazlewood to Vijay, 1 run, targets the rib-cage, Vijay gets inside the line and tucks it away to fine leg
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, good length, nipping back in closer to off. Vijay covers his stumps and leaves
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, another tempter outside off, Vijay is not going to fall into the trap. Raises his bat
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, pitched up delivery, holding its line just outside off. Vijay shoulders arms
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, much better. Pounds it on a shortish length, keeps it just outside off and Kohli rides the bounce on his toes. Takes the all the heat off it
Pat Cummins to Vijay, byes, 1 run, digs it into the pitch, gets the line wrong. It's way down leg, Paine can only get a hand on it. Trickles away to fine leg
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, trims his length, nibbles it in the corridor and Vijay is a little diffident on the back foot push. Lazily wafts and the ball whistles past the outside edge
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, Cummins is mixing it up. Wafts an in-dipper on a fuller length, Vijay reaches forward and presents a text book block
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, short of length and gaining extra bounce just outside off, Vijay judges it well and lifts his bat

Pat Cummins to Vijay, FOUR, this should ease Vijay's nerves. Tasty half-volley from Cummins as he overcooks. Vijay nicely gets onto the front foot, shows his flair and panache. Drives it fabulously through extra cover

Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, oh dear! Kohli nearly did a Rahul there. Gets caught in a state of flux. Sees the incoming delivery very late, thought about playing it till the last second. Gets his bat out, but the ball shapes in and takes the face of the bat, rolling to second slip
Hazlewood to Kohli, FOUR, Kohli takes on the short delivery, puts his weight back and spots no demons, so rolls his wrists and pulls it emphatically through square leg
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, 136.6kph, scrambled seam delivery, wobbling away one square foot outside off. Kohli hides his bat behind
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, dishes a pitched up delivery outside off, enticing Kohli to drive. The Indian captain isn't taking the bait, shoulders arms wisely
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, back of a length and shaping away outside off, Kohli lifts his bat and lets it go
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, full and zeroing at the stumps, Kohli stays inside the line and defends it to mid-on

Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, now, the fuller delivery in a bid to draw Vijay forward and gets it to straighten. Just enough movement to elude the outside edge. In fact, Vijay managed to pull his bat inside the line, so harsh to call it a beaten
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, another splice-jarring delivery, Vijay meets it high on the bat
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, cross-seam delivery, that rears up awkwardly at Vijay, who takes it on the glove and it rolls to cover
Pat Cummins to Vijay, no run, spitting from a length, Vijay arches his back and gets out of the firing line after dropping his gloves

Pat Cummins to Kohli, 3 runs, Kohli is off the mark. Sees a shortish delivery outside off, opens his bat face at the last moment and guides it past gully. Bit of a teaser for the fielders - in the end, they manage to pull it back near the ropes. One run saved
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, fuller and just outside off, Kohli gets forward and eases it calmly off the front foot

Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, in-angling fullish ball, Vijay presses forward and pushes it with his bat close to the pad. Half-an-appeal from Hazlewood for lbw, but nothing more than that. And, it's tea on day four!
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, 137.7kph, back of a length delivery, Vijay rides the bounce and taps it to point
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, edged and falls short! An out-seamer just outside off and Vijay had to play at it, the outside edge is caught, but falls well in front of the second slip fielder
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, angled in from wide of the crease, Vijay defends from the crease
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, Hazlewood sprays it further wide and Vijay is happy to not offer any shot
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, Vijay spots the line outside off and shoulders arms

Starc to Kohli, no run, 145.9kph! It was in the air for a while, but lands in the vacant short leg region. An inswinging short of length ball and Kohli was beaten for pace there. He was late to close his bat-face and the ball died down on the leg-side off his thigh pad. There might have been a glove too. Kohli sports a wry smile
Starc to Vijay, 1 run, shapes in and ends up on the pads, flicked down to fine leg
Starc to Vijay, no run, fuller in length and Vijay push-drives it straight to cover off the front foot
Starc to Vijay, wide, a bouncer over the batsman's head and Vijay half-ducked to evade it. Wided. A one-handed grab by Paine - excellent take, saved four runs

Starc to Vijay, no run, Vijay is beaten on the outside edge and still manages to smile looking at the face of Starc. The left-armer hurled it fuller and drew the right-hander into a drive. Vijay chased it for a drive and the ball whizzed past the outside edge
Starc to Vijay, no run, away-angler outside off at 145.1kph and Vijay shoulders arms. A stare follows from the bowler
Starc to Vijay, no run, 141.4kph, swings in a bit does this length ball, Vijay defends down the pitch
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, short ball angled down leg, Kohli walks across and bends forward to let it go

Hazlewood to Pujara, out Caught by Paine!! Two down! Australia have managed to dismiss Pujara quickly - which has been a rarity this series. Over to Kohli, now? Once again, there's extra bounce on this back of a length delivery which seamed away off the deck around the fifth/sixth stump line. Pujara is lured to stick his bat out with no feet movement and the ball brushes his glove before settling into the keeper's mitts. Australia know the value of this wicket. Pujara c Paine b Hazlewood 4(11) [4s-1]
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, 138.6kph, extra bounce on this short of length delivery, Pujara does well to adjust that and drops it adjacent to the pitch on the off-side with soft hands
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, moving away off the deck at 139.7kph, too wide and Pujara is content in letting that go
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, Hazlewood shortens his length, Pujara defends on the off-side

Hazlewood to Pujara, FOUR, 140.9kph, fullish ball, seamed away a bit and Pujara was half-forward to block, was playing with soft hands and hence the ball rolls all along the ground. Past the cordon and into the third man fence
Starc to Vijay, no run, sharp bumper at 149.3kph, just down leg and Vijay half-ducks under it. Starc has a word or two with the batsman and Vijay replies along with a smile
Starc to Vijay, FOUR, Starc hurls it full outside off and Vijay drives off the front foot with an opened bat-face. Places it well wide of the gully fielder. The new ball bullets away to the fence
Starc to Vijay, no run, 141.5kph, back of a length delivery just outside off, Vijay hops and angles it to backward point
Starc to Vijay, no run, slanted across the right-hander, Vijay lets it go
Starc to Vijay, byes, FOUR, that just took off from a length, was well outside off and Vijay shouldered arms. Paine leapt full-length to his left, but the ball just kept going. Must have hit a crack
Starc to Vijay, no run, good length ball angled across outside off, a watchful leave from Vijay follows
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, 134.9kph, shortish ball just outside off, Pujara rides the bounce and drops it into the off-side
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, Hazlewood shortens his length and gets it shape away from the right-hander, but the line is too wide outside off, nothing doing from Pujara
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, harmless length ball wide of off, left alone

Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, Pujara has been hit on the glove. Seam-up delivery, hit the deck on a length and reared up more than Pujara would have wanted it to. He was looking to work it through the leg-side and got rapped on the bottom hand, which came off the bat immediately after the impact
Hazlewood to Vijay, 1 run, Vijay gets off the mark, tucks this rib-tickler to fine leg
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, back of a length delivery around the off-stump line, Vijay hops across and taps it towards point
Starc to Pujara, no run, 143.9kph, short of a good length ball closer to off, but Pujara is happy to let it pass. A wicket-maiden from Starc who gives a stare to the batsman
Starc to Pujara, no run, pacy length ball wide of off, left alone

Starc to Rahul, out Bowled!! Bowled him! Starc is pumped up. He was uncertain - the Indian opener. Hint of inswing for Starc from a length and Rahul was in two minds - whether to play or leave. Chose the latter, but was too late to withdraw his bat. The ball hits the bat and deflects onto the stumps. Ideal start for Australia! Had there been no bat, the ball would have gone straight to the keeper. Rahul b Starc 0(4)
Starc to Rahul, no run, back of a length delivery at 143.2kph, left alone on line
Starc to Rahul, no run, Starc darts it fuller, but sprays it well outside off, left alone
Starc to Rahul, no run, tentative poke from Rahul away from his body. Limited feet movement from Rahul as he goes for the push against this fullish ball at 142.8kph, past the outside edge

Bumrah to Starc, out Bowled!! Bumrah hits the timber! India need 287 runs to go 2-0 up. Jasprit Bumrah kept it simple, from round the wicket bowled a good length ball, a backing away Starc played all around it and the ball hit the top of off. Hazlewood and Starc - Australia's new ball bowlers - sprint away to the dressing room. Starc b Bumrah 14(29) [4s-3]
Bumrah to Hazlewood, 1 run, no yorker, yet! A backing away Hazlewood taps this back of a length delivery to backward point

U Yadav to Starc, FOUR, edged, finds the gap in the cordon and goes away for a four, despite a desperate dive from Bumrah. Umesh Yadav induced the outside edge with this short of length delivery outside off as Starc pushed hard at it. Beats a diving Kohli to his left at slip. 35 is the partnership now
U Yadav to Hazlewood, 1 run, Hazlewood was slightly cramped for room, but Hazlewood does well to scythe it one-handed through point
U Yadav to Hazlewood, no run, pounds this on a short of length and Hazlewood taps it into the off-side
U Yadav to Hazlewood, wide, sharp bumper, Hazlewood moves further leg-side and bends backwards to let it go. Wided for height
U Yadav to Hazlewood, no run, 133.3kph shortish ball on the stumps, Hazlewood stays leg-side and defends it into the pitch
U Yadav to Starc, 1 run, just a tap into the off-side with soft hands after riding the bounce and off they go for a sharp single. Superb running

U Yadav to Hazlewood, 3 runs, back of a length delivery outside off, loads of room outside off, Hazlewood hangs back and has a slash at it. Didn't quite middle it and one hand came off the handle after the impact. Three more to the tally as the ball rolls to deep point
Ishant to Starc, no run, 132.2kph, back of a length delivery just outside off, Starc sticks his bat out and connects with thin air as the ball deflects away off the deck
Ishant to Hazlewood, 1 run, taps this fuller length ball towards cover-point and hares to the other end. Hazlewood was backing away. Partnership: quarter century
Ishant to Hazlewood, no run, shorter and closer to the sticks, Hazlewood crouches and moves away from it. A beaming smile on Starc's face at the other end

Ishant to Hazlewood, FOUR, "these are priceless runs for Australia," says SunnyG on air. Once again, Hazlewood hangs back, arches his back and uses the bowler's pace and width to angle it backward of backward point
Ishant to Hazlewood, no run, fuller ball and attacking the sticks, Hazlewood goes for the drive and inside-edges it to mid-on
Ishant to Hazlewood, no run, full and going away at 134.2kph, Hazlewood pushes and gets beaten on the outside edge

Shami to Starc, FOUR, full on the pads and Starc takes heavy toll of it. No feet movement, but Starc uses his wrists to flick it away behind square on the leg-side. The man in the deep was too fine. The final wicket partnership is now worth 20 runs
Shami to Starc, no run, away-seaming back of a length delivery, Starc stands tall and has a waft at it, fails to make contact

Shami to Hazlewood, 1 run, tad fuller and induces the outside edge of Hazlewood who plays away from the body. Falls short of the gully fielder, who couldn't stop it cleanly - courtesy an awkward bounce
Shami to Hazlewood, no run, better from Shami. On a good length around the fifth/sixth stump line, Hazlewood pokes and misses
Shami to Hazlewood, FOUR, wow! That's a good shot from the No. 11. Stays leg-side of the ball and arches his back to nicely steer this shortish ball through backward point. Got it off the middle
Shami to Hazlewood, no run, another play and a miss! Length ball decking away, Hazlewood drives sans any feet movement and misses

Ishant to Starc, byes, FOUR, loose from Ishant Sharma, handy runs for Australia. Darts a length ball way down leg and Pant can't even get close to it despite a dive. Misses everyone and runs away to the fence
Ishant to Starc, no run, seaming away from a length, Starc backs away and has a push at it, once again misses the outside nick
Ishant to Starc, no run, short ball wide of off, Starc ignores
Ishant to Starc, no run, Starc stays leg-side of the ball and pokes at this short of length delivery just outside off, beaten on the outside edge
Ishant to Hazlewood, 1 run, loud applause for a single. Hazlewood moves leg-side and guides this back of a length delivery to third man
Ishant to Hazlewood, no run, shortish delivery at 131.5kph, a backing away Hazlewood defends it on the off-side
Shami to Starc, FOUR, backs away does Starc and thwacks the ball over mid-off for a four. Did not time it but got enough wood on it to send it away. Aussies will take it with open arms
Shami to Hazlewood, 1 run, backs away and clumsily taps the ball out into the off-side for a single. Hazlewood was all over the place trying to fend that
Shami to Hazlewood, no run, looks to throw his bat outside off and misses
Shami to Hazlewood, no run, backs away and looks to punch it, misses
Shami to Starc, 1 run, banged in and has been nudged away into the on-side off the back foot for a single
Shami to Starc, no run, pings in the short ball outside off and has been left alone
Bumrah to Hazlewood, no run, Hazlewood hangs back and pushes the ball out into the off-side
Bumrah to Hazlewood, no run, the fiesty yorker! Hazlewood stays rooted in his crease and digs the ball out into the on-side
Bumrah to Hazlewood, no run, the short ball dished out and Hazlewood had enough time to sit under it
Bumrah to Hazlewood, no run, backs away again and taps the back of a length delivery into the off-side
Bumrah to Hazlewood, no run, another glorious drive attempted outside off and has been missed
Bumrah to Hazlewood, no run, looks to back away and punch it, misses
Shami to Starc, no run, bangs the ball in again and Starc meets it with a duck followed by a smile. Is it also a hint that my time will come?

Shami to Lyon, out Caught by Hanuma Vihari!! And the blow on to the helmet the previous ball has worked. After the boundary on the first ball, Kohli had a deep point in place. Shami banged it in again and Lyon backed away to slice it. And guess what? The man positioned at deep point comes in and takes an easy catch. Shami has a 6-fer now. Career best figures for him. Lyon c Hanuma Vihari b Shami 5(10) [4s-1]

Shami to Lyon, no run, that was venomous! Gosh. The sound the ball made when it jammed into the helmet was scary. Shami had not liked the cut shot played earlier in the over and banged it in. Lyon was backing away again but Shami went for the head this time and pinged the helmet. The Indian players, led by Kohli, checked on Lyon who seems to be ok. But as per the formalities in case of a blow to the helmet, the physio is out there checking on him
Shami to Lyon, no run, fuller ball and has been toe-ended into the off-side. The man at mid-off picks the ball up
Shami to Lyon, no run, looks to do the same thing again and misses. That darted in a bit from a shorter length and Lyon was backing away but missed the cut
Shami to Lyon, FOUR, short ball, Lyon throws his bat at it and swords the ball over point for a four. Never tried to keep it down
Bumrah to Starc, no run, looks to back away awkwardly and punch it, misses. Bumrah continues to be the tireless assassin
Bumrah to Starc, no run, and again, the bigggggggg heave and miss

Bumrah to Starc, no run, Starc seems to be saving his fingers for the moment. That was pinged in short, it angled in and Starc danced back to poke and miss it. Not at all getting in line with the ball
Bumrah to Starc, no run, shorter delivery outside off and has been left alone
Bumrah to Lyon, 1 run, stays behind the line of the ball this time and tucks it behind square for a single
Bumrah to Lyon, no run, goes for the big heave and misses. Tried hoicking it across the line
Shami to Starc, no run, poky attempt from the crease sans any feet and it again beats the outer edge
Shami to Starc, no run, looks to throw his bat at another wide ball and misses. Did not miss the outer edge by much
Shami to Starc, no run, he is just toying with the swing here. This time gets the ball go away and Starc comes up with a tame poke which misses the ball by a mile
Shami to Starc, no run, stabs the ball outside off and the ball dies down after kissing the turf. It was in the vicinity of the sticks but Starc was all aware of the whereabouts of the ball
Shami to Starc, no run, Starc does not want to get in line with the ball there. Looks to throw his bat at it and misses
Shami to Starc, no run, bangs the ball in short and Starc sways away from it

Bumrah to Lyon, leg byes, FOUR, that was a wild delivery. Misses the yorker again and strays on to the pads. Lyon misses the leg-sidish swish but gets the pad to make contact and send the ball past the dive of Pant for a four
Bumrah to Lyon, no run, low full toss outside off and swung away to beat the push drive. The bowler I guess went for the yorker and missed his mark
Bumrah to Lyon, no run, gets sucked into a full and wide ball, beaten

Bumrah to Pat Cummins, out Bowled!! And the low bounce comes into play now. Pat Cummins looks to stand up to the short of length ball but the ball keeps perilously low for the woodwork to be shattered. Pat Cummins had no chance. No batsman stood a chance against that beastly act from the deck. The demons in the wicket have woken up. They have the batsman under a spell for the moment being. First the barrage of bouncers and now the roll of the dice. Pat Cummins b Bumrah 1(6)
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, gosh! This is unplayable. The batsman is squared up and the ball flies past the outer edge
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, bangs the ball in and Pat Cummins ducks under it
Shami to Starc, no run, fuller and luring, Starc throws the kitchen sink and also the pile of utensils on top of it but only gets a whiff of air in the bargain

Shami to Starc, no run, what a take from Pant! He leapt up like a leopard would on its prey. That too one handed. The left one. Banged in short and the ball kept climbing after it passed the batsman to test the keeper
Shami to Starc, no run, fuller and wider, that was the sucker delivery and Starc throws his bat at it to miss it
Shami to Starc, no run, happy to play the short ball well inside the line of the ball
Shami to Starc, no run, was that a bird or a kite? Flies away well outside off for the keeper to apply the brakes by pouching it

Shami to Khawaja, out Caught by Pant!! Bumps in the short ball and the perfume ball has spread its aroma all over the southpaw. Khawaja looks to fend that short ball from round the wicket and got a faint tickle off the glove for Pant to take it. India are amongst the wickets all of a sudden after a quiet first session. Brute of a ball though. The angle into him ensured he had to play at it and the dangling prod outside off did not help as that might have straightened a bit as well to force the batsman into a reverse C. Khawaja c Pant b Shami 72(213) [4s-5]
Shami to Khawaja, wide, Shami continues with his bumper ploy. This was wide of off and it was too high as well
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, that slips out of his hand and the umpire also deemed it below the waist height. The batsman was taken aback by it and missed it

Starc to Rahane, no run, shortish and on the leg stump, Rahane hops and defends

Starc to Rahane, no run, now that is a rash shot! Full and way outside off stump, Rahane wanted the square-drive, threw his bat at it literally, but the problem was he didn't move his feet, so he wasn't in a good position to meet the ball, missed it by a distance
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, there to be driven through the gap at cover, but Kohli loses the bottom hand grip, the mistimed hit rolls to the left of the fielder close to the batsman
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, fullish delivery just outside off stump, Kohli defends off the front foot
Pat Cummins to Rahane, 3 runs, nicely flicked away off the pads as Pat Cummins bowls full and on the leg stump, worked away to deep square leg
Pat Cummins to Rahane, FOUR, Rahane plays the upper cut well, Cummins bowls short. Rahane gets into great position leaning back, gets right under the ball and gets it from the middle of the bat
Pat Cummins to Rahane, no run, now Rahane is forward to defend, the ball rolls towards square leg off the inside edge
Pat Cummins to Rahane, no run, moves across the stumps and defends this length ball off the front foot
Starc to Rahane, 1 run, another pacy bumper, this time Rahane gloves the pull, lucky that it landed well wide of leg gully/short fine leg
Starc to Rahane, 2 runs, short ball but Rahane wants to take Starc on, didn't control the pull shot and it flies towards the vacant mid-wicket region
Starc to Rahane, no run, tapped to gully

Starc to Rahane, no run, is that another one caught down the leg-side? Paine thought it was out, but Starc wasn't sure, not given out and they don't review. Short of a length delivery down the leg-side, Rahane misses the glance, the ball did brush the shirt, but did it take a bit of glove before? Not really conclusive

Starc to Pujara, out Caught by Paine!! This is so unlucky for Pujara. He showed great determination to keep the bowlers calm when they were really running in hard, but in the end is out to a soft, soft strangle down the leg-side. You can't help those. Nothing but a short of length delivery down the leg-side, maybe a credit for Paine and Starc for placing leg gully there because that could have played on Pujara's mind and he didn't really go full fledged to glance this to fine leg, a faint nick in the end and Paine knew he had his man. Massive blow to India. Pressure on Kohli now. Pujara c Paine b Starc 24(103) [4s-1]
Starc to Pujara, no run, Pujara is nice and ready for this fullish ball and plays with an angled bat to find gully

Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, another inside edge pops off the pad! Gee this is a really good, probing over from Cummins, good length delivery on the stumps, Kohli tries to defend, gets a thick edge and luckily this one doesn't carry to mid-wicket

Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, beaten, great pace and bounce, short of length delivery outside off stump, Kohli not forward, tries to defend and almost poked at it, almost 140kph and the Indian captain had a bit of a scare there
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 2 runs, short of length delivery outside off stump, Kohli punches it to deep backward point

Pat Cummins to Kohli, 5 wides, bouncer and it's flown over the leaping Paine. Short ball, Kohli pulls out of the hook last moment. Paine is stretching his right side, he did receive a few blows while batting
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Kohli lifts the bat and lets it go
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, shortish and outside off stump, Kohli rocks back and punches well, but finds point

Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, oh where's that short leg now? Would have had a chance to grab this probably! Good length delivery on the off stump, Kohli tries to defend off the front foot, gets a thick edge that pops off the pad towards short mid-wicket
Starc to Pujara, no run, nice full delivery angling across the left-hander, Pujara ignores
Starc to Pujara, no run, and Starc immediately bangs it into the pitch with that field, short and down the leg-side, Pujara won't be troubled by those
Starc to Pujara, no run, shortish from Starc, Pujara defends well right under his eyes
Starc to Pujara, no run, defended towards mid-on
Starc to Pujara, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Pujara shoulders arms
Starc to Pujara, no run, very soft hands on the defence, so soft that the ball hardly rolled past the pitch despite being defended
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, well outside off stump, ignored
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Kohli shoulders arms
Pat Cummins to Pujara, 1 run, straying on the leg stump, Pujara glances it to fine leg

Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, Cummins was so convinced that this looked close, but technology proves the umpire right. This pitch has bounce, yes, Che was hit on the back leg, but the impact was still high, almost on the edge on the flap, more towards thigh pad, Pujara was on the back foot to defend, missed this length ball and umpire Chris Gaffaney was spot on with his call. Desperation from Australia to break this stand has cost them a review
Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, defended from the crease
Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, did this nip back off the deck? Pujara was beaten on the flick and this hit him on the side of the abdomen I guess
Starc to Kohli, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, left alone
Starc to Kohli, no run, another testing delivery - just coming back in - and another good leave, good length delivery outside off stump, Kohli covers the off stump and lets it pass
Starc to Kohli, no run, full and angled across outside off stump, Starc is playing on Kohli's patience, it's a simple leave for the moment
Starc to Kohli, no run, short of length delivery on the off stump, Kohli defends off the back foot

Starc to Kohli, no run, that's a really good leave. Such a good ball, pitching on a good length and just outside off stump, Starc brings it back into the right-hander, but Kohli is so sure about his off stump that he leaves the ball alone despite it being so close
Starc to Kohli, no run, outside off stump, left alone

Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, there's that sharp incoming ball to surprise Kohli, but he's normally good off his pads, although he inside-edges the flick onto pad this time to this length delivery, rolls towards square leg and they take a run
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, outswinger well outside off stump, not that full to force a Kohli drive, ignored
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, the straight drive is absolutely fine from Kohli, but he finds Cummins in the way. Nice and full on the stumps, driven firmly, denied four runs
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, bounce from good length for Cummins, but Kohli lifts his bat high this time to respect the bowler
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, this isn't as full as the previous one, so he is composed enough to defend from the crease

Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, oh Virat! Why Virat! Brilliant bowling from Pat Cummins. Full and swinging away wide outside off stump, Kohli can't stop himself from driving at wide ones away from the body, could so easily have been a repeat of Adelaide, but luck is on his side for now, the edge is just missed
Starc to Pujara, no run, this is the temping ball from Starc, wants Che to drive away from the body, but the No. 3 batsman simply won't take the bait, left alone
Starc to Pujara, no run, watchful from Che, very watchfully defends this length ball with soft hands and plays towards gully
Starc to Pujara, no run, full and outside off stump, Pujara covers the off stump and lets it pass
Starc to Pujara, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Pujara shoulders arms

Starc to Kohli, 3 runs, there's the wide one that is bowled for Kohli to chase away from the body, maybe you can give him credit for this because it's too full and not a driving length to target cover, he reaches out, opens the bat face and guides it past point
Starc to Kohli, no run, starts with a shortish ball on the off stump, Kohli hops and defends
Lyon to Pujara, no run, a shimmy down, followed by a clip to mid-wicket. And, it's tea on day two!
Lyon to Pujara, no run, Pujara is half-forward to block, wasn't close to the pitch and the ball drops short of the silly point fielder
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, Lyon drags his length back and Kohli nudges it to backward square leg off the back foot

Lyon to Kohli, FOUR, cracking shot! Lyon overpitches it outside off and Kohli takes full toll of it. Reaches out by bending his back leg and whips the drive through extra cover. First boundary in 22 overs
Lyon to Kohli, no run, an optimistic shout for lbw from Paine. Nothing from Lyon. A flat offie and Kohli missed the flick. The impact was on leg and that was comfortably missing leg
Lyon to Kohli, no run, Kohli gets forward to push this length ball back to Lyon
Hazlewood to Pujara, 2 runs, hurled very full at 139.6kph and Pujara clips it away into the mid-wicket region off the inside half of the bat
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, bouncer angling down leg at 134.3kph, Pujara half-ducks to evade it
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, attacks the stumps from a good length does Hazlewood, Pujara is solid in his defence
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, angled in from wide of the crease, but still the line is outside off, hence can't induce a shot from Pujara
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, full at 138.1kph, way outside off and Pujara won't chase those
Hazlewood to Pujara, 2 runs, straying on the pads and Pujara glances it through backward square leg for a brace
Lyon to Kohli, no run, tad too short outside off, kept out into the off-side off the back foot by the Indian skipper
Lyon to Pujara, 1 run, gets close to the pitch of the ball by dancing down and push-drives it to the left of mid-on. A tumbling stop from Starc and he seems to be in some discomfort
Lyon to Pujara, no run, Lyon drags his length back by a fraction, defended to short leg
Lyon to Pujara, no run, fuller and outside off at 90kph, Pujara comes down the track and clips it to mid-wicket off the inside half
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, Kohli goes back and nurdles it backward of square leg for an easy single
Lyon to Kohli, no run, forward and blunted to the left of FSL
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, attacks the off-stump from a length and Pujara is solid in his defence

Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, good short-pitched delivery that kept coming in with the angle, Pujara watches the ball like a hawk, arches his back and sways away from the line. And, yeah, the bat was low as well. Perfect leave

Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, fuller than a good length ball, Pujara is early to plonk his bat forward on his block. The ball also brushes Pujara's arm before dying down on the leg-side. A clear and loud 'no' from India's No. 3 to his partner
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, closer to off-stump from a shortened length, Pujara trusts the bounce and lets it pass
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, fuller in length, but Hazlewood persists with the line outside off, another leave
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, angles in a length ball around the fifth stump channel, left alone
Lyon to Kohli, no run, in-spinner, after a good stride forward Kohli decides to shoulder arms
Lyon to Kohli, no run, Kohli leans forward and drives straight to wide mid-off
Lyon to Kohli, no run, clipped to mid-wicket

Lyon to Pujara, 3 runs, first run in 18 balls for Pujara against Lyon. He waltzes down the track and moves off-side in the process to whip the off-break on middle to deep backward square leg. The batsmen take three and it's also the fifty partnership! Glove-love follows
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, too straight at 91kph, spinning down leg and Kohli helps it on its way to fine leg
Lyon to Kohli, no run, goes back to work it through the on-side, finds forward short leg
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, good length ball on midddle at 141.1kph, Pujara stays in his crease and defends it to mid-on
Hazlewood to Kohli, 1 run, pushed with hard hands and Kohli gets a big inside edge against this in-slanter. A single to fine leg
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, bumper at 138.2kph, Kohli easily ducks under it
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, darts a good length ball on the stumps at 139.7kph, Kohli was looking to bunt it into the on-side, gets a soft leading edge that dies down on the off-side
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, good length ball at 138.6kph, comes in with the angle, Kohli knows where his off-stump is, lets it go through to the keeper
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, fuller than a good length ball, knocked to mid-on

Lyon to Pujara, no run, cries of 'catch it' but don't think there was any bat/glove on it. Another overspinner from Lyon and Pujara had his bat firmly behind the pad. The ball ballooned up and fell in the no-mans's land around the point region
Lyon to Pujara, no run, tad shorter and Lyon persists with line outside off, Pujara lifts his bat and allows the ball to thud into his pad
Lyon to Pujara, no run, skips down and offers his pad to this ball well outside off
Lyon to Pujara, no run, 88.7kph, overspin, going down leg, Pujara looks to whip it away and loses his balance a bit. Might have brushed his pad and Paine does a good job to catch that
Lyon to Pujara, no run, punched to wide mid-on
Lyon to Pujara, no run, nudged into the leg-side
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, fuller and marginally outside off, Kohli drives hard off the front foot, Cummins mops it up at mid-off

Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, almost a nick! Kohli can afford a wry smile. He knows how close that was. The sucker ball, fullish and outside off and Kohli almost fell for it. Looks to have a feel for it and was lucky not to get an outside edge
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, 137kph, slanted in around off, compactly defended into the off-side off the front foot
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, fuller and outside off at 138.2kph, Kohli lets it be
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, skiddy delivery at 136.8kph from a shortened length and this one came in with the angle, left alone
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, on good length and outside off, Kohli gets forward to have a feel for it, plays with soft hands and hence the outside edge doesn't carry to the second slip fielder
Lyon to Pujara, no run, short of length at 88.8kph, Pujara rocks back and nudges this offie towards short mid-wicket
Lyon to Pujara, no run, another back-footed barricade into the pitch from Pujara
Lyon to Pujara, no run, tad short and Pujara blocks it back to the bowler
Lyon to Pujara, no run, this is turning out to be an excellent battle! A flat ball that doesn't turn much outside off and Pujara had his bat behind the pad to let it go through to the keeper

Lyon to Pujara, no run, Pujara comes down the track and is beaten by the spin, looked to flick and got beaten on the inside edge. Gets hit on the pad, but the impact was well outside off. Pujara turns around and puts in the dive as the ball went wide of silly point
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, a lean across and follows it with a push down to long-on. That was fecthed from outside off
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, spots the line outside off and Pujara is happy to not offer any stroke
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, full ball curling in at 138.5kph, Pujara covers his sticks with his front leg and shoulders arms
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, short ball well outside off, ignored by Pujara
Hazlewood to Kohli, 3 runs, good looking shot! Walks across and meets this in-angler with a punchy drive. Didn't over-hit and relied on timing. Three more to the tally
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, very full on this occasion, Kohli push-drives it towards extra cover
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, starts the new spell with a back of a length whick took off, a surprised Kohli does well to drop it on the off-side. He rises up and fends it off the top part of the bat
Lyon to Pujara, no run, once again Pujara uses his feet by charging down, isn't to the pitch and hence knocks it towards mid-on

Lyon to Pujara, no run, superb stop by Lyon, flies to his left and saves a few runs. Pujara danced down the track to convert this flighted delivery into a half-volley and then drove it wide of the bowler all along the carpet. Good cricket!
Lyon to Pujara, no run, a lunge forward to defend it to the right of the bowler
Lyon to Pujara, no run, this one's bowled wide of off and Pujara kicks it away after skipping out of his crease
Lyon to Pujara, no run, 91.3kph, tad short and wide of off, Pujara finds the backward point fielder with his cut shot
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, flighted delivery, Kohli plays in the direction of the spin to mid-wicket
Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, darted full at 139.5kph, Pujara plonks his bat across to block it back towards Cummins
Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, short of length delivery around off, Pujara plays with soft hands to defend it towards the gully region
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, short-pitched delivery at 141.5kph, Kohli swivels across and pulls it behind square leg with one leg off the ground
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, spots the line outside off and shoulders arms. Good carry-through to the keeper
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, Cummins persists with the fullish ball, this one was darted at 142.4kph, Kohli offers a straight bat to block it back to the bowler
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, 135.3kph, fuller length ball angled into the right-hander, Kohli plays with hard hands on the push and only manages an inside edge that dies down on the pitch
Lyon to Pujara, no run, flat offie on the stumps, Pujara dead-bats it off the back foot
Lyon to Pujara, no run, skips down the track and pads this shortened length ball on the off-side. It was bowled well outside off and Pujara had his bat behind the pad
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, full and outside off, Kohli uses those wrists to play a whippy drive to long-on
Lyon to Kohli, no run, overpitched outside off, rare bad ball from Lyon but he gets away as Kohli thumps it straight to cover
Lyon to Kohli, no run, Kohli gets forward to work it through the leg-side, closes the bat-face early and gets a leading edge. The ball pops up, but falls well short of backward point
Lyon to Pujara, 1 run, allows the ball to do its bit and turns it to square leg off the back foot
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, almost a nick! A half-forward Kohli sticks his bat out to an out-seamer around the fifth stump line. Whizzes past the outside edge
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, 143.8kph, slightly too short, Kohli hangs back in his crease to blunt it into the on-side
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, short of length delivery at 138.6kph around off, Kohli is back and across to barricade it on the off-side
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, moves away off the deck from a length, left alone on line
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, testing line and length, good length ball at 139.5kph in that nagging zone outside off, Kohli pokes and gets beaten on the outside edge
Pat Cummins to Pujara, 3 runs, not a great ball! Fuller length ball on leg and Pujara flicks it through mid-wicket for a triple
Lyon to Kohli, no run, top over this from Lyon! A maiden. Tosses it well outside off and draws Kohli forward, who push-drives it away from his body and finds the cover fielder
Lyon to Kohli, no run, tad short and quicker ball at 90kph, punched off the back foot, Lyon dives to his right and makes a good stop
Lyon to Kohli, no run, 89kph, fractionally outside off, Kohli presses forward in defence
Lyon to Kohli, no run, punched to short mid-wicket
Lyon to Kohli, no run, Kohli gets forward and nudges it with the spin into the leg-side
Lyon to Kohli, no run, a dangerous leave from Kohli. Turn and bounce for Lyon. Pitched well outside off and spun in sharply, the bounce saves Kohli. Over the off-pole. Mighty close!
Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, full and angling in. Pujara shows the full face of the bat and blocks it out
Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, rises up with the bounce and defends it down under his eyes
Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, goes back and taps the ball out into the off-side
Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, pokes at it outside off and the ball finds the outer edge to go third slip
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, too full, clipped fine to fine leg for a single

Pat Cummins to Kohli, leg byes, 2 runs, tucked away behind square for a double. That was rising on him and angled in for the batter to work it away. In fact it seemed to be off the thigh pad as the third umpire signalled it leg-byes
Lyon to Pujara, no run, again targetting the channel outside off and Pujara steers back to push it away to mid-off
Lyon to Pujara, no run, stays back and pushes it back to the bowler
Lyon to Pujara, no run, skips down the track and blocks it away to FSL

Lyon to Pujara, no run, little bit of bounce outside off and has been stabbed out into the off-side
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run, stays behind the line of the ball and tucks it square of the wicket for a single
Pat Cummins to Pujara, no run, that is a snorter! Almost sniffs the outer edge on its way to the keeper. That straightened outside off and took off for the batter to play at it and miss it
Pat Cummins to Kohli, 1 run, pushes the ball away into the covers for a single
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, yorkerish delivery and has been clipped out to mid-on. Again, Virat did not over commit and that allowed him to dig the ball out
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, fuller ball outside off and has been pushed away into the off-side

Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, clips it away sans any feet and the man at mid-on dives to his right to stop it

Lyon to Pujara, no run, skips down the track again and clips it to short mid
Lyon to Pujara, no run, charges out, tucks the ball away to short mid
Lyon to Pujara, no run, goes back and pushes the ball away into the off-side
Lyon to Pujara, no run, front footed stride and has been steered away with a slightly closed face of the bat to short third man

Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, shorter outside off and Pujara is pleased to see it through

Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, in angler from slightly wide of the crease and has been left alone
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, bangs the ball in and Pujara ducks under it
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, gets squared up as the ball nibbled away a tad bit. The ball took the outer edge to find the man at gully
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, nipping in from a length and has been stabbed out into the on-side
Pat Cummins to Kohli, no run, closer to the batsman and on a shorter length, Kohli raises his bat and lets it go

Hazlewood to Kohli, FOUR, this is all class! My o my! He is seeing the ball like a football. Run scoring was supposed to be tough on this track. But then this man is a run machine for no reason. Waited on the fuller ball on the pads and clipped it away between mid-on and mid-wicket for a four
Hazlewood to Kohli, no run, angles it in and has been stabbed out into the off-side

Hazlewood to Kohli, FOUR, and now the off-drive! All class. The crowd is going berserk. Fuller ball outside off and Kohli just leant into the drive to ensure it missed the man at mid-off. Back-to-back splendid shots from the modern day master
Hazlewood to Kohli, FOUR, the craftsman seems to be in the zone! That was full and at the base of the sticks, Kohli eased into the clip and got it between mid-on and mid-wicket for a four
Starc to Pujara, 2 runs, back of a length delivery on the pads, tucked behind square for a double

Starc to Pujara, no run, nicks the shirt on the way through to the keeper as Pujara missed the tuck. That was dug in short down leg and Pujara missed the tuck. The keeper went up instantly but Starc never did and they decided against reviewing that
Starc to Pujara, no run, nice shape away from the batter, Pujara plays well inside the line of the ball and gets beaten. Pujara played for the angle but could not cover the line of the ball

Starc to Pujara, FOUR, full ball well outside off and has been driven on the up from Pujara. Lovely strike from Pujara as driving has been tough on this wicket. But it was too full and Pujara was quick to pounce on it
Starc to Pujara, no run, away going delivery outside off and misses the outer edge as Pujara poked forward
Starc to Pujara, no run, back of a length delivery outside off and has been stabbed out into the off-side

Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, edged and does not carry! That lands just short of the man at first slip. Again closing the face of the bat and the ball went off the outer edge. Marsh at first slip found it just short of him
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, nibbling away outside off and has been shouldered arms to by Pujara
Hazlewood to Pujara, no run, that straightened after landing. The batsman tried to play with an angled bat and missed to be hit high on the thigh

Starc to Pujara, no run, how is your throat Mr. Pujara? Here is a whiff of air, says Starc as he bowls the bumper going away from the batter

Hazlewood to Kohli, FOUR, on-drive! Glorious. The bat maker's name is same as well. The little legend used to lean into the on-drives like this. Rang a bell?
