Hazlewood to Rahul, out Bowled!! Corker from Hazlewood. Rahul plays all around it and misses it to be cleaned up. India in deep trouble. That was right up there and the little movement in the air might have done him in. 6th wicket of the day. Rahul stayed rooted inside the crease and his feet hardly moved to compensate for the line and the length. Rahul b Hazlewood 2(17)

Starc to Rahul, 1 run, waits on the fuller length ball and then clips it away. Of course it helped that the ball was on the pads and was heading down but Rahul played it late and did not over commit trying to tickle it
Starc to Rahul, no run, little nip inwards but left on length just outside off
Starc to Rahul, no run, angling across the right-hander and has been left alone
Starc to Pujara, 1 run, decks in and has been tucked away behind square for a single
Starc to Pujara, no run, length delivery outside off and has been ignored
Starc to Pujara, no run, uhhhhh! That curves in the air and Pujara plays close to his body to bunt the ball out. Starc is able to swing it in and that is when he is the most threatening
Hazlewood to Rahul, no run, back of a length delivery outside off and has been left alone
Hazlewood to Rahul, no run, fuller outside off and has been left alone
Hazlewood to Rahul, no run, bangs it in outside off and has been left alone
Hazlewood to Rahul, no run, angling in and fuller in length. Rahul gets cramped on the clip and inside edges the ball on to the pads
Hazlewood to Rahul, no run, angling in and has been fended away into the off-side
Hazlewood to Rahul, no run, nibbling away delivery outside off and has been blocked into the off-side

Starc to Vijay, out Bowled!! Told ya! It was coming - the big, booming inswinger. Goes straight through Vijay's defences to rattle the stumps and Starc roars in joy. Australia have struck early as Vijay departs for a duck. Full, pace and had danger written all over it. Swung back in menacingly, Vijay's cemented feet has led to his downfall. Was late in bringing his bat down, expected it to move away but it came back in, goes through the bat-pad gate to disturb the furniture. It will also be lunch with the fall of that wicket. Vijay b Starc 0(12)
Starc to Vijay, no run, 146.4kph, Starc is upping his pace. But his line is a little wayward. It's down leg and Vijay misses the glance, off the pad to Paine - who flies across and collects it
Starc to Vijay, no run, good line from Starc, slightly closer to off - the back of a length delivery - but it doesn't warrant Vijay to flirt at it. Hoists his bat
Starc to Vijay, no run, "No" shouts Vijay after tapping it with soft hands to point
Starc to Vijay, no ball, short of length and peckering away the sixth stump channel, Vijay lifts his bat and lets it go. Starc has overstepped and it's been called a no-ball

Starc to Vijay, no run, 142.1kph, Starc is setting the batsman up by hurling the outswinger very full outside off. Easy leave for Vijay, but he must be wary now because there will be one coming in towards him
Starc to Rahul, 1 run, pacy inswinger, gets it a bit on leg-stump and Rahul clears his front leg to glance it away to fine leg
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, 138.1kph, wafts it fuller and lures Vijay forward. Cleverly gets it to seam away, Vijay didn't bother to cover the line and gets beaten all ends up
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, fuller length and angling in towards middle and leg. Wristed gently to mid-wicket
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, lovely shape from Hazlewood. Pitched on a length, gets it to straighten as the ball held its line with Vijay hanging his bat at that. Whistles past the outside edge
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, short, swerves it on off. Vijay stays back, gets behind the line and defends
Hazlewood to Vijay, no run, short of length and kicking up outside off, left alone

Hazlewood to Vijay, leg byes, FOUR, that's a poor start from Hazlewood, the inswinger goes awry and Vijay makes him pay. Gets inside the line and tickles it fine to send it away to the fine leg fence. Vijay gets off the mark with a boundary? Nope, it's given as leg-byes. Yikes!
Starc to Rahul, no run, very full at 141.8kph, Rahul spots it early and lifts his bat

Starc to Rahul, no run, shows better judgement on this occasion. Nipping back in from a length, venomous bounce after pitching just outside off and Rahul raises his bat upwards. Encouraging carry for Paine
Starc to Rahul, no run, dodgy from Rahul. Fuller and curling away outside off, Rahul attempts a feeble push away from his body with no feet. It jags away, beating the outside edge. Nervy..
Starc to Rahul, no run, brings it back into the right-hander on a fuller length just outside off, Rahul tackles it by getting a stride forward and defends it neatly
Starc to Rahul, no run, shortens his length and gets it to deck away miles outside off, Rahul ignores
Starc to Rahul, no run, a full outswinger first up from Starc, just outside off and Rahul gets half-forward, sees it's moving away from him. Keeps his bat inside the line and lets it pass

Ishant to Hazlewood, out Caught by Pant!! And gone. Hazlewood bags a first-ball duck and Australia have been bowled out for 326. Two in two for Ishant. On a good length and just outside off, Hazlewood with a tentative poke and outside edge is found once again. Flew to Pant's left, superb reflexes shown by the Indian wicket-keeper diving and nestling in his gloves. Hazlewood c Pant b Ishant 0(1)

Ishant to Starc, out Caught by Pant!! This was on the cards. Starc wasn't showing any signs of spending time in the crease. Sharma kept it simple, pitched it fuller and enticed the batsman to go for it. Starc obliged and swung his bat hastily, thick outside ensues and Pant moves to his left to grab it in front of his face. This dismissal is very similar to the one in the first innings in Adelaide. Australia nine down, subdued celebrations from India. Starc c Pant b Ishant 6(10)
Ishant to Lyon, leg byes, 1 run, slipping down leg, Lyon misses the tickle and gets it off the thigh pad towards fine leg. Shami mops it up
Shami to Starc, no run, better. Shami goes wide of the crease and lasers it in just outside off, Starc watches it all along and leaves
Shami to Starc, no run, poor from Starc. This was dropped on a back of a length, tailing away outside off. Starc feels for it without any intent, inches away from kissing the outside edge
Shami to Starc, no run, back of a length delivery wide of off, left alone
Shami to Lyon, 1 run, short of length delivery at 134.4kph, Lyon shuffles across and turns it neatly into the mid-wicket pocket for a single
Shami to Starc, 3 runs, in-angler from round the wicket, Starc swings his bat and lifts it over mid-wicket off the inside half. Three more to the tally. Ishant from mid-on runs back to hunt it down
Shami to Starc, no run, digs it half-way down the track, well outside off and Starc stands motionless, letting pass
U Yadav to Starc, 1 run, closed-bat face nudge, it stopped upon reaching Starc, slamming it high on the bat towards mid-wicket
U Yadav to Lyon, 1 run, rolling of the wrists from Lyon, gets across and works it through square leg
U Yadav to Lyon, no run, banged it short, good wheels and Lyon ducks under it

U Yadav to Lyon, 2 runs, tad fuller just outside off, Lyon checks his defence off the meat past mid-off. Just a minamalistic push, it flew away. Two more. Pant takes a few steps forward and has a few words to offer to Lyon
U Yadav to Lyon, 2 runs, chipped airly, in the gap at mid-wicket. Two nabbed

U Yadav to Lyon, no run, was there a noise? I heard something. The men behind the stumps went up as well, but Yadav shakes his head with a wry smile. Very identical delivery to the one that beat Cummins in his previous over. Held its line after pitching just outside off, Lyon was playing for the original line and the ball moves just enough to elude the edge
Bumrah to Starc, 2 runs, aims for the blockhole delivery, turns out to be a low full toss. Whipped through mid-wicket to pick up a brace
Bumrah to Starc, no run, 142.3kph, fuller and just outside off, Starc ungainly jabs it to mid-on
Bumrah to Starc, no run, Bumrah goes round the wicket and slants it in, jammed back
Bumrah to Lyon, 3 runs, shaping back in, clipped through square leg. They will collect three

Bumrah to Paine, out Lbw!! Paine has been trapped by Bumrah. Up goes the dreaded finger of umpire Chris Gaffaney and he's reviewed it straightaway. Not a no-ball. No bat either. Ball-tracking says it's hitting the leg-stump, so the on-field call stays. Two wickets in a span of three balls for India, what a turnaround. Bumrah deserved this scalp. Back of a length and skidded through the deck, Paine went deep in his crease and failed to get bat - falls a bit over as well. Misses it altogether as the ball nipped in a fraction to strike him on the pads. In-front of middle and Paine took a chance by going for a review, but in vain. Paine lbw b Bumrah 38(89) [4s-5]
Bumrah to Paine, no run, gets behind the line and defends

U Yadav to Pat Cummins, out Bowled!! What a peach from U Yadav. Needed something special like this to remove Cummins. The 69-run stand has been broken. This was on a goodish length, Cummins was fatally caught in the crease - with feet rooted. Should've been forward. It just held it's line after pitching, Cummins was playing for the in-dipper and it beats the outside edge to kiss the off-stump. Beauty! Pat Cummins b U Yadav 19(66)
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, cutting in from a length, Cummins bends a little forward and guides it to point
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, tests Cummins with a bouncer, the batsman comfortably sits under it
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, gets nicely inside the line and presents a straight bat

U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, beaten! Top nut from Yadav. Landed on a length, gets it to hold its line and Cummins kept his bat straight, meaning playing for the incoming ball, but the ball changed direction to miss the outside edge by a whisker
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, moving away well outside off, left alone

Bumrah to Paine, FOUR, gift wrapped and sent to Paine. This was a loose delivery from Bumrah, probably went for the yorker and missed it by a few inches. It ends up as a juicy low full toss and Paine strokes it ram-rod straight down the ground

Bumrah to Paine, no run, rib-tickler, cramping Paine for space. The Australian skipper failed to read the extra bounce on this occasion and gets knocked on the midriff area. Of course, he's wearing the protection equipment
Bumrah to Paine, no run, whangs it into the pitch, bumper from Bumrah and it kicks up outside off. Paine sways out of the line
Bumrah to Paine, no run, 140.2kph, Bumrah examines the corridor of uncertainty, but Paine prefers to shoulder arms
Bumrah to Paine, no run, shorter again, the line is just outside off and Paine defends it off the back foot into the off-side
Bumrah to Paine, no run, short of length and Paine gets very deep in his crease to tuck it to the fielder at short leg
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, Cummins was squared up trying to work this outswinger into the on-side, the ball rolls back to the bowler off the outer half of the bat
U Yadav to Paine, 1 run, this is nicely played, allowed the short of length delivery to come and played it to close to the body, guiding it to the left of the man at backward point
U Yadav to Paine, no run, a loud shot of no from Paine as he defends this short of length delivery to point
U Yadav to Paine, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Paine taps it towards point
U Yadav to Paine, no run, yet another blow on the thigh pad, "oooh" is the expression from Paine, he was beaten by this short of length delivery as he tried to flick
U Yadav to Paine, no run, genuine outswinger from Umesh and it lures Paine into the drive and beats him all ends up
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, fullish and just outside off stump, Cummins defends
Bumrah to Paine, 1 run, oh where's this going? Paine has checked his pull shot, lucky that it didn't carrt to mid-wicket, short ball, Paine wasn't in control of the shot
Bumrah to Paine, no run, watchfully tries to defend off the back foot, gets an inside edge onto thigh pad
Bumrah to Paine, no run, fullish ball outside off stump, Paine defends to point

Bumrah to Paine, no run, oh my word! He's really banging this into this surface and getting to it bounce from a good length, the whip of the shoulder there, Paine was completely beaten on the back foot defence
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Cummins guides it to third man
U Yadav to Paine, no run, full delivery outside off stump, Paine defends it onto his toe
U Yadav to Paine, no run, oh Paine tried to leave this good length delivery, but this one kicked up and flew towards Kohli at second slip off the face of the bat, just dropped short of him
U Yadav to Paine, no run, good length delivery on the off stump, Paine defends off the front foot
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, leg byes, 1 run, appeal for LBW, but this is easily missing leg, hit on the flap of the pad, there was inside edge as well, but the umpire missed it, given leg byes
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, 2 runs, nicely tucked to the left of mid-wicket for a couple of runs, fifty partnership comes up
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, good length delivery on the stumps, Cummins flicks it to mid-wicket

Bumrah to Paine, no run, again goes past the bat. Full and wide outside off stump, Paine plays away from the body with no feet and misses. Bumrah has beaten the bat thrice in his first over of the day
Bumrah to Paine, no run, short of length delivery angling in, with a bit of bounce, Paine defends it onto the thigh pad
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, 1 run, good running from Paine, inside edge onto thigh pad and the ball stays on the pitch, the Australian captain calls for a run and that raises the 300
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, and again! Back of a length and outside off stump, Cummins is completely opened up by the late movement away from him off the pitch, almost pokes it to the keeper
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, beaten, good length delivery outside off stump, Cummins plays inside the line of the ball and misses the defence
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, fullish delivery outside off stump, just a hint of nip away, Cummins lets it go
U Yadav to Paine, no run, outswinger wide outside off stump
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Cummins taps it to cover, to the left of cover, Rahul almost overruns and stops with his right hand
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, fullish and outside off stump, Cummins defends towards short cover
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, outside off, ignored
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, short and wide outside off stump, Cummins lets it pass
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Cummins not interested in playing at those

Ishant to Paine, no run, looks like this one has missed the thigh pad and crashed near the hip, Paine is feeling the pain but jogs to the other end, inswinging short of length delivery beats the flick and hits him on the body
Ishant to Pat Cummins, 1 run, too straight and on the stumps, flicked to deep mid-wicket
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, short delivery down the leg-side, Cummins lets it go
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, first appeal of the day, LBW shout, but that was too high, inswinger beats Cummins' defence and thuds him high on the pad, will have bounced over the leg stump
Ishant to Paine, leg byes, 1 run, inside edge onto pad but there is no one at short leg, Paine was troubled by the inswinger, the edge saved him there
Ishant to Paine, no run, very full and on the stumps, Paine flicks it to mid-on
Shami to Pat Cummins, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Cummins covers the line and shoulders arms
Shami to Paine, 1 run, oh this one has bounced and seamed, excellent bouncer, Paine didn't have anywhere to escape, the ball rolls to fine leg off the glove
Shami to Paine, 2 runs, now there is a man at deep square leg but Paine has pulled this short ball wide of him towards deep mid-wicket
Shami to Pat Cummins, leg byes, 1 run, hit on the thigh pad and they set off for a run, Cummins missed the flick, the ball rolled beside the pitch and Paine was quick to call for a run
Shami to Pat Cummins, no run, overpitched outside off stump, Cummins lets it go
Shami to Pat Cummins, no run, full delivery outside off stump, Cummins lets it go
Ishant to Paine, no run, fullish delivery outside off stump, Paine defends off the front foot
Ishant to Paine, no run, good length delivery on the stumps, Paine defends
Ishant to Paine, no run, nicely blocked from the crease
Ishant to Paine, no run, short delivery on the stumps, Paine ducks under it
Ishant to Paine, no run, fuller length delivery outside off stump, Paine defends off the front foot, looked like this one just held its line after pitching
Ishant to Pat Cummins, 1 run, shortish delivery on the leg stump, Cummins stands tall and glances it to fine leg
Shami to Paine, FOUR, nicely punched away off the back foot, short of length delivery outside off stump, lot of room on offer so Paine frees his arms and times it sweetly for four

Shami to Paine, no run, oh Paine is hit on the thigh, shortish ball, but doesn't rise much, Paine wanted to pull, pulled out of the shot because of lack of bounce, lucky that it hit the protected area
Shami to Paine, no run, this is short and wide outside off stump, left alone
Shami to Paine, no run, short of length delivery just outside off stump, Paine defends off the back foot
Shami to Paine, no run, good length delivery outside off stump, Paine lifts his bat and lets it go
Shami to Paine, no run, short ball and Paine is floored as he sways out. The bat wasn't down, excellent bouncer, heading towards the head, Paine did well to move away too
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, full and outside off stump, Cummins shoulders arms

Ishant to Paine, 1 run, run-out missed? Paine taps it to short cover and sets off, Pat Cummins rushes to the other end, Rahul tried to attack the ball with one hand and fire a direct-hit but doesn't pick up the ball
Ishant to Paine, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Paine defends off the back foot
Ishant to Pat Cummins, 1 run, leans forward and tries to defend, the ball takes the inside edge and goes to fine leg
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, this has been fired down the leg-side, Cummins misses the tickle
Ishant to Paine, 1 run, excellent inswinger on the off stump, Paine hurriedly got the bat down to save his wicket, managed to flick uppishly to mid-wicket off the inside half of the bat
Shami to Pat Cummins, no run, oh Cummins almost drags it on trying to leave this length ball, the ball took the edge and luckily hit the pad
Shami to Pat Cummins, no run, full and outside off stump, Cummins lets it pass
Shami to Pat Cummins, no run, short of length delivery cutting back in, Cummins does well to cover the line and defend
Shami to Paine, 1 run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Paine guides it to third man
Shami to Paine, no run, the short ball is followed by a full ball, Paine covers the stumps and lets it go

Shami to Paine, FOUR, that's not pulled with control but the deep backward square leg area is unmanned. Bit of a top edge but it's landed safely in the deep, good short ball from Shami, Paine instinctively went for the pull shot, just reacted to the ball than actually intending to play
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, this is a nice leave, covers the off stump nicely, knows it's not going to swing back much and hit the sticks, so lets it pass
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, beaten, full and outside off stump, Cummins leans forward to defend, he expected the ball to nip back in, but it held its line on that occasion
Ishant to Paine, 1 run, bit of bounce on this short of length delivery outside off stump, Paine stands tall and guides it to third man

Ishant to Paine, no run, ohh that's almost shaved the leg stump. Paine walked across the stumps and exposed middle and leg, Ishant slipped in the inswinger on a fuller length and beat Paine on the flick, bat was obstructed by the pad, and the ball was so close to taking the edge and the stump
Ishant to Paine, no run, short of length delivery outside off stump, Paine lifts his bat and lets it go
Ishant to Paine, no run, good start from Ishant as well. Inswinger on a fullish length and just outside off stump, Paine is patient enough to let the ball go
Shami to Paine, 1 run, back of a length and nipping back in, nudged carefully to mid-wicket
Shami to Paine, no run, testing full ball outside off stump, Paine pushes it to cover without coming forward and says for the run
Shami to Paine, no run, fullish and outside off stump, Paine lets it pass
Shami to Paine, no run, shortish and spraying down the leg-side, ignored by the batsman
Shami to Paine, no run, now this one cuts back in, but Shami is bowling in the right areas, in the corridor of uncertainty but that's a good leave
Shami to Paine, no run, nice start from Shami. Good length delivery just outside off stump, Paine covers the stumps and lets this go, the ball moves away and Pant collects around neck height

Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, Bumrah appeals for lbw, the umpire isn't interested and the bowler himself says to his skipper that there was bat involved. This in-angler kept low and Cummins was lucky to get some bat on it before getting hit on the front pad. The cue end of the willow saves Cummins. And that's stumps on day one!
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, banged in short at 140.5, Cummins evades by ducking under it
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, tries to bowl a yorker and ends up doling a full toss, Cummins hangs back to push it to mid-on
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, stays in the crease does Cummins, allows the ball to come to him and pokes it to backward point
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, too quick for Cummins! This good length ball zipped through and Cummins was late to stick his bat out. Whizzes past the outside edge
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, skiddy length ball, Cummins stays leg-side of the ball to blunt it on the off-side
Shami to Pat Cummins, 1 run, seams in sharply and Cummins somehow manages to get an inside edge on the block and the ball dies down on the leg-side adjacent to the pitch

Shami to Pat Cummins, wide, another good grab by Rishabh Pant. Moved to his right, jumped full length to his left and caught it with one hand. The bouncer too short and angled down leg, Cummins ducked to let it go. Wided for height
Shami to Pat Cummins, 2 runs, hurled full and there's no movement either in the air on off the deck, Cummins presses forward and drives it through cover-point
Shami to Pat Cummins, no run, Cummins is solid in defence against this in-slanter
Shami to Pat Cummins, no run, back of a length delivery, Cummins goes back in the crease and opens his bat-face to punch it straight to backward point
Shami to Paine, 1 run, on the shorter side, Paine rises on his toes and punhces it to the left of cover
Shami to Paine, no run, hint of away movement off the deck, left alone

Bumrah to Paine, 1 run, Bumrah has his hands on the head! A skiddy bumper and Paine is hurried into his pull shot. Didn't time it well as it got big on him, but fortunately for the Australian captain, it fell well short of the deep square leg fielder
Bumrah to Paine, no run, fuller length delivery, pushed towards backward point
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, 3 runs, fuller length ball on leg at 143.6kph, Cummins doesn't over-hit, just a knock to the right of mid-on for a triple. Ishant runs back and hunts it down
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, 139.9kph bumper outside off, left alone and that's a good take from Rishabh Pant - who jumps full length to snaffle that
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, pacy length ball, Cummins defends with an opened bat-face. The backward point fielder was quick to tidy it up
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, 139.6kph, in-slanter, Cummins hops in his crease and taps it to mid-off
U Yadav to Paine, no run, short of a good length ball, poked to backward point from the crease
U Yadav to Paine, no run, out-seaming delivery at 136.6kph, Paine lets it be
U Yadav to Paine, no run, hurled full and Paine defensively pushes it to mid-off
U Yadav to Paine, no run, 136.7kph, back of a length delivery, Paine covers the line and blocks it down the pitch

U Yadav to Pat Cummins, 1 run, a slight mix-up, but they comfortably take a single in the end. Extra bounce on this short of length ball and the ball went wide of gully off the shoulder of the bat. A sharp single taken, it was Paine's call
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, good length ball holding its line outside off, left alone

Bumrah to Pat Cummins, legbyes, 1 run, slips in the yorker and Cummins misses the flick/clip. The angle would have taken it down leg. Bumrah was interested, but Kohli doesn't go for a review. Right call from the Indian skipper
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, bangs one short, but the line is wide outside off, Cummins ignires it by sitting and swaying away from it
Bumrah to Paine, 1 run, 146kph, good length ball, Paine moves off-side and works it into the mid-wicket region
Bumrah to Paine, no run, a shuffle across to knock this 143kph fuller length ball to mid-on
Bumrah to Pat Cummins, 1 run, straighter line and Cummins glances it to long leg

Bumrah to Pat Cummins, no run, this is incredible bowling from Bumrah! That's very similar to a leg-break just that the pace is over 140ks. Angles in, hits on a fuller length and seams away past the outside edge. Cummins was playing for the in-angler and hence plonked his bat inside the line

U Yadav to Paine, FOUR, good shot! Umesh Yadav shortens his length and Paine spots it quickly. Stays on the back foot, swivels across and rolls his writs to pull it through backward square leg. Made superb contact
U Yadav to Paine, no run, fuller in length, pushed towards point

U Yadav to Pat Cummins, 1 run, shortened length with loads of width outside off, Cummins cuts off the back foot and goes to backward point on the bounce. It bounced awkwardly and Vihari couldn't stop it cleanly
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, 2 runs, hangs back allows this length ball to come and deliberately opens his bat-face to guide it between third slip and gully
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, pitched up and moving away, Cummins goes for the booming drive and gets beaten on the outside edge
U Yadav to Pat Cummins, no run, good length ball shaping away, left alone
Bumrah to Paine, 2 runs, straighter line, Paine gets inside the line and tucks it behind square on the leg-side for a couple
Bumrah to Paine, no run, short of length delivery, seams away and Paine taps it towards backward point off the back foot

Bumrah to Paine, byes, FOUR, this is a vicious ball! It just took off from a length, seamed away as well - probably hit the crack. Paine was looking to work it through the leg-side, the ball bounced well over the keeper's head from a good length! Unbelievable! "What was the that?," says Tim Paine after having a look at the pitch
Bumrah to Paine, no run, that's a jaffa! Angled in, hit the deck around off on a good length and seamed away to beat the outside edge of Paine. How do you play that? Lucky not to get a nick on it
Bumrah to Paine, no run, wide full toss at 139.4kph and Bumrah gets away with it. Paine reaches out and square-drives it staright to backward point
Bumrah to Paine, no run, cuts in sharply at 132.7kph from a length, but Paine had his sticks covered before deciding to let it go through to the keeper
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, another inswinger, from a shortened length, Cummins spots the line outside off and shoulders arms. A wicket-maiden
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, walks forward and across to dead-bat this pitched up delivery
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, gets this full length ball to curl in does Ishant, Cummins presses forward and taps it to short extra cover
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, 131kph, gentle inswinger, left alone on line which was well outside off
Ishant to Pat Cummins, no run, full inswinger on the stumps, watchfully blocked down the pitch

Ishant to Head, out Caught by Shami!! Can you believe it? Head has holed out at third man. The umpires want to check if it's a legal ball. Yes, no problem with that and Head has to depart. Early Christmas gift for Ishant Sharma. It was full and outside off, Head plays away from his body and flashed his bat hard at it.
